headline: How Macron and Lecornu learned to govern without a majority
subhead: By giving his prime minister more leeway, the French president abandoned his 'Jupiterian' style of leadership. In return, he has regained space to weigh in on issues beyond his usual prerogatives.

headline: Havana, a ghost town battered by shortages and US threats
Trump battles Minneapolis shooting fallout as two immigration agents put on leave
Escaped Syrian detainees recount chaos after Kurdish forces withdraw
subhead: The transfer of security control over prisons and detention camps from the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces to the authorities in Damascus unfolded amid total confusion, allowing several dozen prisoners to escape. Each side has blamed the other for the incident.

headline: John Bolton: 'Toppling the Iranian regime is the most effective way to remove the terrorist threat the West has faced'
subhead: The former US national security adviser argues, in an op-ed for Le Monde, that the EU stands out for its passivity in the face of the Islamic Republic, while that dictatorship carries out assassinations of dissidents in Europe, supports international terrorism and poses a nuclear threat.

headline: French Sénat adopts a bill to ease the return of colonial-era artifacts to their countries of origin
subhead: The new legislation aims to broaden the restitution of colonial-era assets, introducing clear criteria and a transparent process for handling requests from the countries involved.

headline: Denmark's long and difficult reckoning with America's abandonment
subhead: Since the end of the Cold War, the Scandinavian kingdom pursued a 'super-Atlanticist' strategy in hopes that the US would come to its aid when needed. Now, trust between Washington and Copenhagen has been broken.

headline: 2026 FIFA World Cup: Los Angeles mayor urges the Trump administration to reassure international fans
China executes 11 linked to Myanmar online scam gangs
Sweden lowers criminal responsibility to age 13
White House and Slovak PM deny report on Trump's mental state
Plane crashes near Colombia and Venezuela border, killing 15
Charles Kushner, Trump's man in Paris
France backs EU move to label Iran's Revolutionary Guards a terrorist group
'For sure': Two impromptu words by Macron go viral
France is still trading uranium with Russia, nearly four years after Ukraine invasion
French finance minister urges Capgemini explain its contract with ICE
French senators reject assisted dying bill, send it back to lower house
Veteran civil servant Xavier Piechaczyk to head Paris public transports
Work-related cancers remain a blind spot in France's public health system
subhead: A study conducted by doctors and occupational sociologists at the Avignon Hospital Center on over 500 lymphoma patients found there was a 'massive underestimation' of work-related cancers in France.

headline: How India and the EU created a common market to counter Trump
subhead: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and representatives of the European Union concluded a trade agreement on January 27, after nearly 20 years of intermittent negotiations, opening up a market of nearly two billion people.

headline: Richard Ford: 'I tell my European friends how it feels not to understand my country'
subhead: The novelist expresses concern, in an op-ed for Le Monde, about the direction his country has taken under President Donald Trump. He laments that Americans do not appear to pay attention to the erosion of their constitutional rights, nor do they grasp how difficult it will be to turn back.

headline: A pragmatic trade agreement between India and the EU
Europe: 'A new social federalism must be invented as the response of democratic states to empires'
Israel is trying to evict Doctors Without Borders from Gaza
